basics.name: Jike Wang
basics.label: Ph.D. Student
basics.summary: My research lies at the intersection of AIoT, wireless sensing, and mobile robotics, with a current focus on magnetic sensing (e.g., Polaris and METRO) for robust perception in complex, real-world environments.

education.summary: Research Interests: AIoT, Wireless Sensing, Mobile Robotics. Advisors: Prof. Dongyao Chen.

publications.name: DualStrike: Accurate, Real-time Eavesdropping and Injection of Keystrokes on Commodity Keyboards
publications.publisher: Network and Distributed System Security (NDSS) Symposium

publications.name: Polaris: Accurate, Vision-free Fiducials for Mobile Robots with Magnetic Constellation
Demo: Implementation and Benchmark of Magnetic Tracking on Mobile Platforms
METRO: Magnetic Road Markings for All-weather, Smart Roads

projects.name: Polaris: Accurate, Vision-free Fiducials for Mobile Robots with Magnetic Constellation
projects.summary: A vision-free magnetic fiducial system achieving sub-millimeter pose estimation (<1 mm/1°) with low-power deployment (25.08 mW).

projects.name: METRO: Magnetic Road Markings for All-weather, Smart Roads
projects.summary: First magnetic road-marking solution with long-term real-world deployment and >96% robust perception under high-speed/noisy conditions.

awards.title: Best Presentation Award, Rising Star Forum, AIoTSys 2025
First Prize, Outstanding PhD Academic Forum

volunteer.summary: Evaluated reproducibility and functionality of submitted research artifacts.
CS1501 Programming Methodology (2021–2025 Fall, class size 88–96, A-grade eval in 2022 Fall); CS106 Programming Practice (2022 Summer, 2023 Summer).
